messages.subject: FROM SOLOMON JULIET
messages.body:
solomon_juliet@virgilio.it
27/01/2005 12:32

cc:

FROM SOLOMON JULIET
ABIDJAN COTE D'IVOIRE,
WEST AFRICA.
Dearest One,
I got your contact address on my desperate search for a reliable person/company
for partnership investments overseas. By introduction, I am SOLOMON JULIET
Sierra Leonean and son of late DR IBRAHIM JULIET .Before the death of my
father he disclosed to me about the total sum of $22 million US dollarshe
deposited under a suspense account with a bank in Abidjan Cote d Ivoire.
This fund represent the huge Sales of Gold and Diamond he diverted while
in office as the director general for Gold and Diamond Mining Co-Opretionin
in SierraLeone .For security reason according to my late father,

he made an agreement with the bank that his partner/beneficiary will come
forward to submit his banking details for onward transfer of the fund to
his account. DR IBRAHIM JULIET , my late father advice me in case if he
dies that I should look for a for eigner who will stand as the beneficiary
of the fund so that the fund will be transfer to his/her account for partnership
investment. Right now, I am in Abidjan Ivory Coast, transferring this fund
to a trustworthy account .

Meanwhile, I am writing to know if you can stand as the beneficiary of the
fund and to also provide me your banking details so that I will submit it
to the bank for transfer of the fund for partnership investment you will
introduce in your country. Note that after the transfer is made to youraccount,
you will then withdraw some money and send to us in order for me and my
sister secure the necessary documents to enable us come over to meet you
for the investment.

On confirmation of your interest to assist us,the certificate of deposit
with the lodgement receipt of the fund which was issued to my late father
by the bank on the day he deposited the fund will be forward to you for
your confirmation. 10% of the total sum will be offered to you for your
assistance, while 5% will be set aside for any expenses that might arise
during the transfer. Indicate your interest as soon as you received this
mail, and note that this transaction need to be confidential.

YOURS SINCERELY,

FROM SOLOMON JULIET

SOLOMON JULIET

This fund represent the huge Sales of Gold and Diamond he diverted while in office as the director general for Gold and Diamond Mining Co-Opretionin in SierraLeone .For security reason according to my late father,

DR IBRAHIM JULIET , my late father advice me in case if he dies that I should look for a for eigner who will stand as the beneficiary of the fund so that the fund will be transfer to his/her account for partnership investment. messages.body:
Dear Solomon

I am amazed how you should have got hold of this private e-mail, but your kind offer has greatly intrigued us.

Please tell us more, and reassure us that this is not sort of joke. We get so much these days from any number of colonial tom dick or harrys, with a mind to ask for charity.

I have taken the liberty of copying this message to my colleague, Dr Charles Farnes Barnes who is in charge of our investment sector. He has some experience with the Third World and I am sure between us we will see you get what you deserve.

MARMITE

Sir Marmite Luny-Binns DFC
Regis Court Chamberlain
The Court of St James
Broadmoor
London FU2 GIT
messages.raw:
MARMITE LUNY-BINNS

Date: 27 Jan 2005

I have taken the liberty of copying this message to my colleague, Dr Charles Farnes Barnes who is in charge of our investment sector. He has some experience with the Third World and I am sure between us we will see you get what you deserve.

MARMITE

Sir Marmite Luny-Binns DFC
Regis Court Chamberlain
The Court of St James
Broadmoor
London FU2 GIT

messages.body:
Dear Solomon Juliet,

Sir Marmite Lunny-Binns has passed your e-mail to me.

I believe we may assist you in this business to our mutual benefit. However, I need you to assure me that the transaction is ceteris paribus and can be undertaken in the strictest confidence by your financial and legal associates.

As an international banker of many years experience I realise that certain fees may be incurred and it would be best if you let me know as soon as possible if such fees are payable. This will allow us to complete our business quickly.

I look forward to hearing from you,

Yours truly,

Dr Charles Farnes-Barnes,

Chief Executive Officer, Kreplach Brothers Merchant Bank

International PLC

Lampard House

69 Mourinho Avenue

London SW6 1FU
messages.raw:
SIR CHARLES FARNES-BARNES

Sir Marmite Lunny-Binns has passed your e-mail to me.

I believe we may assist you in this business to our mutual benefit. However, I need you to assure me that the transaction is ceteris paribus and can be undertaken in the strictest confidence by your financial and legal associates.

As an international banker of many years experience I realise that certain fees may be incurred and it would be best if you let me know as soon as possible if such fees are payable. This will allow us to complete our business quickly.

I look forward to hearing from you,

Yours truly,

Dr Charles Farnes-Barnes,
Chief Executive Officer, Kreplach Brothers Merchant Bank International PLC
Lampard House
69 Mourinho Avenue
London SW6 1FU

messages.body:
DADDY
 I thank you immensely for your quick response to my proposal and i say may
 this mail find you well and all the blessings of the almighty Lord shall
 follow you in all your endeavours of life.

 With your response i am quite convinced of your person and ready to transact
 this business with you on the basis of the trust which i am beginning to
 have on you, i pray that the most high God be with you in all your endeavours
 in life.

 In response to my proposal, my father when he was alive deposited the fund
 in a bank under a "suspence  fixed excrow account"here when his business
 was
 flourishing and used my name as the only heir alive to be the next of kin
 in respect to the promises that he made to my mother before her death on
 the hospital bed 1984 that he will not marry another woman in order for
 me and my younger sister not to be maltreated in any way, this he has kept
 till his last
 minute in this wicked world which we live today.

 When i went to visit my father on the hospital before his death, he told
 me everything about this money and gave me all relevant documentary proof
 regards to the claim but he stressed out that i need the assistance
 of a foreign partner who will assist me in the claim because according to
 him he did insert a clause on the  money that his foreign business partner
 who is also the beneficiary of the said fund will be coming for the claim
 but his name and contact was withhold from the bank, i believe my father
 did it this way for
 security purpose or he must have confided to some one whom he was unable
 to disclose to me before his death.

 Now, on one occassion when i went to the bank to see if i can claim some
 money for medical treatment of my younger sister, i was denied access by
 the bank, in response they told me that my father entered an agreement with
 them that until i will be 30 years of age before the money will be release
 to me or if the beneficiary comes whose name is concealed.

 With regards to this i was shown the agreement entered between my father
 and the bank where i confirm all my father told me before his death and
 that of the bank but in addidtion it was clearly stated that i the next
 of kin or the depositor who is my father will be the one to appoint the
 account to which the money can be transfered, since my dad is dead i will
 be the one
 to do just that .

 This has compel me to contact you in this regards as the long awaited beneficiary
 of the fund in the bank by forwarding you r viable and legitmate bank account
 details which i will submit to the bank with your contact informtions as
 belonging to my late father's foreign partner and the co-beneficiary of
 the fund as well for the transfer to be effected
 believing that you will not sit on this money when it is confirmed in your
 account.

 Based on this sir, i sincerely beg for your understanding of a mutual benefit
 and belive that  i did not contact you out of selfish interest rather it
 is for a mutual benefit. All i am requesting from you now is for your to
 open thet new bank acount as you have promised and then forward to me the
 full information, On receipt of the above informations i will move to the
 bank to submit the informations as belonging to my late fathers foreign
 partner and the co-beneficiary of the fund also i will forward to you the
 documents of deposit issued to my late father on the day he made the deposit
 with the bank for your perusal and to enable you contact the bank for the
 quick transfer of the said fund in your nominated bank  account.

 Permit me to ask you some few questions;How old are you ? Are you married
 if yes how many kids have you? what is your religion? Will you take me as
 part of you? Will you promise to keep all documents and coresspondence confidential
 considering my plights and sittuation? I wait your quick response in this
 regards.

 Finally Sir, i do not have the access of international call for we are
 at the present under the assylum camp, so i kindly beg you to reply me as
 soon as posible for us to have better discussions of more understanding.
 I once again say a big thanks to you and may the almighty Lord bless you
 and guide you in all your endeavours of life.

 Thanks.

 Yours sincerely

 solomon
messages.raw:
SOLOMON JULIET

To: "Marmite Luny-Binns"
Date: Fri, 28 Jan 2005

DADDY
I thank you immensely for your quick response to my proposal and i say may this mail find you well and all the blessings of the almighty Lord shall follow you in all your endeavours of life.

With your response i am quite convinced of your person and ready to transact this business with you on the basis of the trust which i am beginning to have on you, i pray that the most high God be with you in all your endeavours in life.

In response to my proposal, my father when he was alive deposited the fund in a bank under a "suspence fixed excrow account"here when his business was flourishing and used my name as the only heir alive to be the next of kin in respect to the promises that he made to my mother before her death on the hospital bed 1984 that he will not marry another woman in order for me and my younger sister not to be maltreated in any way, this he has kept till his last minute in this wicked world which we live today.

When i went to visit my father on the hospital before his death, he told me everything about this money and gave me all relevant documentary proof regards to the claim but he stressed out that i need the assistance of a foreign partner who will assist me in the claim because according to him he did insert a clause on the money that his foreign business partner who is also the beneficiary of the said fund will be coming for the claim but his name and contact was withhold from the bank, i believe my father did it this way for security purpose or he must have confided to some one whom he was unable to disclose to me before his death.

Now, on one occassion when i went to the bank to see if i can claim some money for medical treatment of my younger sister, i was denied access by the bank, in response they told me that my father entered an agreement with them that until i will be 30 years of age before the money will be release to me or if the beneficiary comes whose name is concealed.

With regards to this i was shown the agreement entered between my father and the bank where i confirm all my father told me before his death and that of the bank but in addidtion it was clearly stated that i the next of kin or the depositor who is my father will be the one to appoint the account to which the money can be transfered, since my dad is dead i will be the one to do just that .

This has compel me to contact you in this regards as the long awaited beneficiary of the fund in the bank by forwarding you r viable and legitmate bank account details which i will submit to the bank with your contact informtions as belonging to my late father's foreign partner and the co-beneficiary of the fund as well for the transfer to be effected believing that you will not sit on this money when it is confirmed in your account.

Based on this sir, i sincerely beg for your understanding of a mutual benefit and belive that i did not contact you out of selfish interest rather it is for a mutual benefit. All i am requesting from you now is for your to open thet new bank acount as you have promised and then forward to me the full information, On receipt of the above informations i will move to the bank to submit the informations as belonging to my late fathers foreign partner and the co-beneficiary of the fund also i will forward to you the documents of deposit issued to my late father on the day he made the deposit with the bank for your perusal and to enable you contact the bank for the quick transfer of the said fund in your nominated bank account.

Permit me to ask you some few questions;How old are you ? Are you married if yes how many kids have you? what is your religion? Will you take me as part of you? Will you promise to keep all documents and coresspondence confidential considering my plights and sittuation? I wait your quick response in this regards.

Finally Sir, i do not have the access of international call for we are at the present under the assylum camp, so i kindly beg you to reply me as soon as posible for us to have better discussions of more understanding. I once again say a big thanks to you and may the almighty Lord bless you and guide you in all your endeavours of life.

Thanks.

Yours sincerely
solomon

messages.body:
Dear Solomon

I am touched that you have written back so promptly, and in so much detail. It shows to my mind just what a deserved case you really are. Although in normal business relations I might take your several questions as rather impertinent, on this occasion I am prepared to offer the details you request.

In short sir, I am 56, married to Lady Agatha Bristol, with two children.  I am Church of England (and in fact proudly led a rousing chorus of 'Lord God, Unto Thee We Pledge Our Vimto' at the cathedral only last weekend before the congregation). As for discretion, you may rest assured that We will see that your case receives exactly the sort of privacy it deserves. I hope this answers your concerns.

If I may, I would like to pose some questions to your good self: can I, by return, be assured of your complete confidence? Do you have many wives? And most importantly, are you willing to sign The Oath of Temporary Obedience in this our prospective royal business? Palace protocol being what it is, I am afraid this must be attended to before we can proceed, and in rather short order, I am sure you understand. It is a prerequisite before any business is agreed by the household here, and requires you to sign a document and submit photographic proof of identity.

MARMITE

Sir Marmite Luny-Binns DFC
Regis Court Chamberlain
The Court of St James
Broadmoor
London FU2 GIT
messages.raw:
MARMITE LUNY-BINNS

Date: 28 Jan 2005

Dear Solomon

I am touched that you have written back so promptly, and in so much detail. It shows to my mind just what a deserved case you really are. Although in normal business relations I might take your several questions as rather impertinent, on this occasion I am prepared to offer the details you request.

In short sir, I am 56, married to Lady Agatha Bristol, with two children. I am Church of England (and in fact proudly led a rousing chorus of 'Lord God, Unto Thee We Pledge Our Vimto' at the cathedral only last weekend before the congregation). As for discretion, you may rest assured that We will see that your case receives exactly the sort of privacy it deserves. I hope this answers your concerns.

If I may, I would like to pose some questions to your good self: can I, by return, be assured of your complete confidence? Do you have many wives? And most importantly, are you willing to sign The Oath of Temporary Obedience in this our prospective royal business? Palace protocol being what it is, I am afraid this must be attended to before we can proceed, and in rather short order, I am sure you understand. It is a prerequisite before any business is agreed by the household here, and requires you to sign a document and submit photographic proof of identity.

MARMITE

Sir Marmite Luny-Binns DFC
Regis Court Chamberlain
The Court of St James
Broadmoor
London FU2 GIT

[We are as surprised as you to learn that Sir Marmite is married to Lady Agatha Bristol, CBE. But then we are only the Janitorial Department and possibly this was on a need-to-know basis.]

messages.body:
Jan. 31:

Dear Solomon 

Please read your e-mail more carefully. Last week I informed you that Dr Farnes-Barnes is away till Wednesday afternoon.

There is no point telephoning you until you confirm  that this transaction is ceteris paribus. Once you do so we can then proceed to complete our business.

Yours truly,

Eidur
messages.raw:
EIDUR ROBBEN-KEZMAN

Jan. 31:

Dear Solomon [if I may]
Please read your e-mail more carefully. Last week I informed you that Dr Farnes-Barnes is away till Wednesday afternoon.

There is no point telephoning you until you confirm [by e-mail or post] that this transaction is ceteris paribus. Once you do so we can then proceed to complete our business.

Yours truly,

Eidur

messages.body:
1 February 2005

Dear Solly,

This is indeed good news and I will inform Dr Farnes-Barnes that you have confirmed that the transaction is ceteris paribus on his return to the office tomorrow afternoon.

Meanwhile, in response to the other query in his e-mail to you, perhaps you may care to send details of any bank fees that may be payable to complete our business. This will also save time.

I am sending a copy of this e-mail to our esteemed client, Sir Marmite Luny-Binns.

Yours sincerely,
Eidur Robben-Kezman
Personal Assistant to Dr Charles Farnes-Barnes

EIDUR ROBBEN-KEZMAN

messages.body:
Smarmy,

I really don't approve of this, darling. These native
layabouts are known for their fraudulent activities.
You and Charlie should know better, if I may say; you
have known what The Special Operations Department gets
up to.

Please do think carefully.

Agathax
Lady Agatha Bristol, CBE
Head of Special Operations, Foreign Office, London
messages.raw:
AGATHA BRISTOL

Date: 01 Feb 2005

messages.body:
Dear Solomong

I have just returned after a spot of bison hunting in Smegaroon and fine this strange message from you. What is this number you have given me? Is it for you or a colleague?  Please let us proceed with this business, as I feel I am being spread a little too thinly what with one delay after another.

MARMITE

Sir Marmite Luny-Binns DFC
Regis Court Chamberlain
The Court of St James
Broadmoor

6 February

Dear Solly,

Fine, but the letter had best come from my esteemed client Sir Marmite Lunny-Binns VC. For your information his bank details are as follows:

Kreplach Bros Merchant Bank International

Account No: 3266419

However, to speed things up I am sending him a copy of your e-mail and this reply. No doubt you will hear very shortly from him.

With kindest regards,

Dr Charles Farnes-Barnes

messages.body:
7 February

Dear Solly and Sister,

Read my last e-mail to you which I sent off yesterday. I repeat, the money must be transferred not to my account but to the account of Sir Marmite Lunny-Binns VC.

Send him details as to where he must e-mail his bank details and we can proceed immediately with the transfer. You have his e-mail address but to save time here it is again: xxxxx

I can appreciate that you need to finish this business as soon as possible but it is you and not Sir Marmite and myself who are holding things up.

Yours truly,

Dr Charles Farnes-Barnes
messages.raw:
SIR CHARLES FARNES-BARNES

7 February

Dear Solly and Sister,

Read my last e-mail to you which I sent off yesterday. I repeat, the money must be transferred not to my account but to the account of Sir Marmite Lunny-Binns VC.

Send him details as to where he must e-mail his bank details and we can proceed immediately with the transfer. You have his e-mail address but to save time here it is again: xxxxx

I can appreciate that you need to finish this business as soon as possible but it is you and not Sir Marmite and myself who are holding things up.

Yours truly,

Dr Charles Farnes-Barnes

bad you need to come to our rescue please. 
We want to hear from you as soon as possible please. 
 
Thanks 
Solomon

Date: Wed, 9 Feb 2005

Dear ,

How are you i have never hear from you since my last mail why? The bank is waiting to hear from you as the beneficary so they can make the transfer but i never hear from you please our condition here is very bad you need to come to our rescue please.
We want to hear from you as soon as possible please.

Thanks
Solomon

messages.body:
10 February 2005

Dear Solly,

I will not e-mail you again unless you can convince me that you are reading my messages.

I have e-mailed you twice about what you must do and that is simply to contact Sir Marmite Lunny-Binns VC and tell him that I have approved the transaction. You have Sir Marmite's bank details - here are the details and this is the third and last time I will send them to you:

Kreplach Bros Merchant Bank International

Account No: 3266419


This is not child's play and we cannot spend any more time on this matter if you cannot proceed as directed.

Dr Charles Farnes-Barnes

Kreplach Bros Merchant Bank International

SIR CHARLES FARNES-BARNES

solomon [I shall give him one last chance - as shown below]

messages.body:
Dear Solly,

As I have told you before, all you have to do is to e-mail Sir Marmite at sirmarmite@hotmail.com and inform him that I have given permission for funds to be transferred - via Western Union - in and out of his account with Kreplach Brothers International Merchant Bank.

Yours sincerely,

Dr Charles Farnes-Barnes

SIR CHARLES FARNES-BARNES

messages.body:
Dear Solomon and Juliet

I am very concerned by the way this business is proceeding. I have tried to get in contact with your Mr Baps twice now but nothing has happened by way of response. Can you try and hurry the fellow along? He needs to get his communications in order as a matter of urgency.

Have you spoken to Mr Farnes Barnes yet?

As it happens I may be visiting your part of the world shortly. Perhaps a face to face meeting at the local Hilton would speed along matters?

MARMITE

Sir Marmite Luny-Binns DFC
Regis Court Chamberlain
The Court of St James
Broadmoor
London FU2 GIT
messages.raw:
